author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
The move has upset regional balance, claims Chief Minister

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Saturday slammed the Centre for not including any city from the State in the list of Smart Cities, saying it had “ignored” Bihar and upset the regional balance. His deputy in the Cabinet, Tejaswi Yadav, too said the Centre’s omission amounted to “discrimination” against Bihar.

“The Bihar government had sent them (the Centre) a proposal as per the required format. Earlier, the Centre had some cities in Bihar for the Smart City list but now they have ignored Bihar,” Mr. Kumar said.

Addressing journalists here, the Chief Minister said though it was the Centre’s decision to develop Smart Cities and it had prepared the criteria to select cities from different States, it had done a U-turn on the project.
title: Nitish laments absence of Bihar on smart cities’ list
